00048 namespace Pika {
00049 
00050 // TODO : documentation with use example
00051 // TODO : I think this one could be based on an arbitrary variables class and use assign, lookup etc of the super-class instead of accessing vars directly. The question is if it would affect performance?
00052 template<class Super, unsigned int CACHE_SIZE = 11> class QuickVars : public Super {
00053         public:         typedef typename Super::ForScript::String String;
00054         public:         typedef typename Super::ForScript::Value Value;
00055         public:         typedef std::pair<String, Value> CacheEntry;
00056                         
00057         public:         unsigned int hash(const String& s) {
00058                                         unsigned int l = static_cast<unsigned int>(s.size());
00059                                         if (s.size() == 1 && s[0] >= 'a' && s[0] <= 'z') return (s[0] - 'a') % CACHE_SIZE;
00060                                         if (s.size() == 2 && s[0] == '$' && s[1] >= '0' && s[1] <= '9') return s[1] - '0';
00061                                         return (s[0] * 1733 + s[l >> 2] * 2069 + s[l >> 1] * 2377 + s[l - 1] * 2851) % CACHE_SIZE;
00062                                 }
00063 
00064         public:         virtual bool assign(const String& identifier, const Value& value) {
00065                                         if (identifier.empty()) return false;
00066                                         unsigned int i = hash(identifier);
00067                                         if (cache[i].first == identifier) { cache[i] = CacheEntry(identifier, value); return true; }
00068                                         if (!cache[i].first.empty()) Super::vars[cache[i].first] = cache[i].second;
00069                                         cache[i] = CacheEntry(identifier, value);
00070                                         return true;
00071                                 }
00072 
00073         public:         virtual bool erase(const String& identifier) {
00074                                         bool erased = (Super::vars.erase(identifier) != 0);
00075                                         unsigned int i = hash(identifier);
00076                                         if (cache[i].first == identifier) { cache[i] = std::pair<const String, Value>(); erased = true; }
00077                                         return erased;
00078                                 }
00079 
00080         public:         virtual bool lookup(const String& identifier, Value& result) {
00081                                         if (identifier.empty()) return false;
00082                                         unsigned int i = hash(identifier);
00083                                         if (cache[i].first == identifier) { result = cache[i].second; return true; }
00084                                         typename Super::VariableMap::const_iterator it = Super::vars.find(identifier);
00085                                         if (it == Super::vars.end()) return false;
00086                                         if (!cache[i].first.empty()) Super::vars[cache[i].first] = cache[i].second;
00087                                         cache[i] = CacheEntry(identifier, it->second);
00088                                         result = it->second;
00089                                         return true;
00090                                 }
00091 
00092         public:         virtual void list(const String& key, typename Super::ForScript::Variables::VarList& list) {
00093                                         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < CACHE_SIZE; ++i)
00094                                                 if (!cache[i].first.empty()) Super::vars[cache[i].first] = cache[i].second;
00095                                         for (typename Super::VariableMap::const_iterator it = Super::vars.lower_bound(key)
00096                                                         ; it != Super::vars.end() && it->first.substr(0, key.size()) == key; ++it)
00097                                                 list.push_back(*it);
00098                                 }
00099 
00100         protected:      CacheEntry cache[CACHE_SIZE];
00101 };
00102 
00103 } // namespace Pika
00104 
00105 #endif
